intro: Pimpinella espanensis, commonly known as Spanish cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and scrublands. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which contain two one-seeded units. Pimpinella espanensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
